Question: This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: If you have to drive at a slow speed which may hold up other vehicles, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep as close as you can to the centre of the road
Keep as close as you can to the left side of the road
Make the traffic behind you slow down to the speed that you are driving at
Drive down the middle of the road so that any vehicles behind you can pass on the left

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Question: What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: How close can you park your vehicle to the approach side of a pedestrian crossing where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
You wish to move your vehicle out of a parking space into the traffic flow. What must you do before you move?

Answers.Answer: Flash your vehicle indicators for 1 second
Signal with your vehicle indicators for at least 3 seconds
Turn on your vehicle parking lights
Use your vehicle brake lights (stop lights)

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
For the purpose of applying the give way rule, entrance ways into public car parks should be treated as:
If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: If you have a rear tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: You may use a right turn bay to overtake a vehicle travelling straight ahead.
When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?
If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: What is the safest way to carry goods inside a vehicle?

Answers.Answer: On the floor by the driver’s feet
On the shelf near the rear window

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road

Question: What does the legal definition of a road include?
